title: [Health] Blood plasma transfusions from exercised mice to inactive mice improved spatial learning memory and mitigated signs of aging in the brain. A key protein abundant in blood plasma from exercised mice (and humans) could be the key to distilling exercise's preventive effects on cognitive decline.

[Neuroscience] An fMRI study finds that an individual's emotional experience while on psilocybin can be predicted by the thickness of their rostral anterior cingulate cortex - a structure in the brain associated with the resolution of emotional conflict
